Description: Both models identify SQL Injection as a critical threat due to the use of databases for sensitive information storage.
Insecure API Endpoints are a common threat, allowing unauthorized access to sensitive operations.
Both models emphasize the need for multi-factor authentication to mitigate insufficient authentication mechanisms.
Regular security configuration audits are recommended in both models to prevent data exposure due to misconfigured security settings.
Improper Input Validation is a shared concern, leading to various attacks including XSS and SQL Injection.
Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities are identified in both models, particularly in user input handling.
Denial of Service (DoS) attacks are a common threat, affecting service availability across both models.
Both models must adhere to data protection regulations such as GDPR, focusing on data exposure risks.
Both models recommend implementing rate limiting to protect against abuse of API endpoints.
Both models emphasize the importance of access control mechanisms to prevent unauthorized data access.
